issue.body:
#### Summary
None
#### Purpose of change
Add a use case for #68772
#### Describe the solution
Add 8 new gunmods, that utilizes overheat mechanic and changes it depending on gunmods
While here, fixed some bugs:
Inventor grenades has way too big crafting time, decreased it
Fixed the heavy modified battery description
Fixed blocky pistol being not rigid
Fixed inventor's grenade launcher jammed every time (in theory)
#### Additional context
Didn't know github can create pull requests right from github dev. Apparently they are created empty

comment.body:
I think you are using cooling_value_multiplier incorrectly.
If you want to improve cooling performance, you need to set a value higher than 1, such as 1.2.

Come to think of it, the gun
"overheat_threshold"
"cooling_value"
"heat_per_shot"
I did not add an explanation regarding.
Should I add them to the GUNMOD in JSON_INFO.md, such as "the more it increases, the better it performs"?

issue.title: NPCs completing their task when they should not

labels.name: <Bug>
labels.description: This needs to be fixed

labels.name: NPC / Factions
labels.description: NPCs, AI, Speech, Factions, Ownership

labels.name: Z-levels
labels.description: Levels below and above ground.

issue.body:
# Describe the bug

They stop reading a book as soon as you change z-level and skip a second in there.

# Steps To Reproduce

1. Load [save](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PKqLl29ilK9ywSRwBPvpa3HdddDK7oUZ/view?usp=sharing), check that NPC nearby is reading.
2. Go downstairs (or use stepladder to get to the roof, doesn't matter).
3. Skip a turn.
4. See new message in the log, return to see she's now following you. Obviously not reading anymore.

# Expected behavior

They should not stop doing their task because I'm using a stair/stepladder/whatever.

# Versions and configuration
- OS: Windows 7
- Game Version: 0.E-5679-g446c750 [64-bit]
- Graphics Version: Tiles
- Game Language: English [en]
- Mods loaded: [
    Dark Days Ahead [dda],
    Disable NPC Needs [no_npc_food],
    Aftershock [aftershock],
    Magiclysm [magiclysm],
    Alternative Map Key [alt_map_key],
    sees-player icon, retrodays [sees_player_retro],
    Stats Through Skills [StatsThroughSkills]
]

comment.body: This sort of stuff is still happening.  My NPCs will complete (ie, interrupt) their crafting tasks whenever I go to sleep nearby, go up or down a Z-level.

issue.body:
#### Summary
Features "Weapon Proficiency"

#### Purpose of change
As it stands, weapon selection in Catacylsm is a choice between the three core damage types of Bash, Slash, and Stab, with the player either selecting whatever does the most damage in the area the have the highest skill, or to choose a sub-optimal weapon for roleplay purposes. This leads to a lack of nuance in weapon selection that isn't as interesting to engage with as it could be.

#### Describe the solution
This adds a system that adds weapon proficiencies for each melee weapon type across three tier of proficiency. A player can now gain category familiarity, category proficiency, and category mastery for each category.  It adds EoCs to allow an increase in each weapon category proficiency, and does so by:

1. Proc the EoCs on a successful hit on either a Monster or a Character
2. Compare each weapon category to the wielded weapon
2.1 On a match with the wielded weapon, check the highest tier of proficiency the player has  in that category
2.2 After finding the highest tier, increment the amount of experience in the relevant tier of proficiency unless already a master
2.3 Compare the lowest tier of proficiency determined so far to the current tier. If the current tier is lower, set lowest tier to current tier.
3. After each category is checked, refund a small amount of stamina spent on the swinging the weapon based on the players lowest matching category proficiency
3.a Familiarity provides a 2.5% refund
3.b Proficiency provides a 5% refund
3.c Mastery provides a 10% refund

#### Describe alternatives you've considered
Other alternatives to this have been tracking proficiency only in the specific item, providing a to-hit bonus based on proficiency, an attack move cost discount, or just leaving the proficiency frame work as it is with no benefit to provide support to later additions.

#### Testing
1. New Character
2. Spawn dummies
3. Spawn weapon of appropriate category
4. Attack dummies
5. Check proficiency gain
6. Debug set proficiency to each tier
7. Attack dummies
8. Observe if results match expectation

#### Additional context
While functional, the descriptions for both the practice recipes and the proficiencies themselves are kinda dull, suggestions are well appreciated.

issue.title: Ash's laptop quest fail due to absent laptop

labels.name: (S1 - Need confirmation)
labels.description: Report waiting on confirmation of reproducibility

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I accepted the quest "Bring Boris his son's lost writing." quest, went to the location, and failed to find the laptop.

Probable cause: Visit to the location prior to visiting the Refugee Center for the first time.

### Attach save file

[West Kingston-trimmed.tar.gz](https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/files/13185813/West.Kingston-trimmed.tar.gz)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Visit a lot of evac shelters.
2. Go to the Refugee Center and go through Boris' quest chain to get the laptop mission.
3. See that the location indicated is one you've visited. If not, restart from scratch.
4. Visit the location indicated again and search for the laptop without success.

### Expected behavior

A. Logic to spawn the laptop in an already explored location; or
B. Introduce logic to target location selection that verifies that the location hasn't been created/realized as a prerequisite for selecting it.

The A. choice has existed in some quests involving terminals in the past (returning to the location has had terminals spawned that weren't available on the previous visit).

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Versions and configuration

- OS: Windows
    - OS Version: 10.0.19045.3570 (22H2)
- Game Version: 0.G-4656-g10cdb0ceaf [64-bit]
- Graphics Version: Tiles
- Game Language: System language []
- Mods loaded: [
    Dark Days Ahead [dda],
    Disable NPC Needs [no_npc_food],
    Portal Storms Ignore NPCs [personal_portal_storms],
    Slowdown Fungal Growth [no_fungal_growth]
]
+ hack to disable portal storms

### Additional context

I've looked through my stash of laptops, and all of them have the same (standard) description.

I've also run a search of the save for the string "Ash" (case sensitive) to find if the object actually exists somewhere (at least the CDDA Item Browser describes an object called "Ash's laptop computer). The only match found is parts of city names plus the filter history for the View command (used to look for the laptop, after having manually searched everything, including lockers).

I'm going to try to work around the issue by debug spawning the laptop, but others may run into the issue as well.

labels.name: EOC: Effects On Condition
labels.description: Anything concerning Effects On Condition

issue.body:
#### Summary
Features "Weapon Proficiency"

#### Purpose of change
As it stands, weapon selection in Catacylsm is a choice between the three core damage types of Bash, Slash, and Stab, with the player either selecting whatever does the most damage in the area the have the highest skill, or to choose a sub-optimal weapon for roleplay purposes. This leads to a lack of nuance in weapon selection that isn't as interesting to engage with as it could be.

#### Describe the solution
This adds a system that adds weapon proficiencies for each melee weapon type across three tier of proficiency. A player can now gain category familiarity, category proficiency, and category mastery for each category.  It adds EoCs to allow an increase in each weapon category proficiency, and does so by:

1. Proc the EoCs on a successful hit on either a Monster or a Character
2. Compare each weapon category to the wielded weapon
2.1 On a match with the wielded weapon, check the highest tier of proficiency the player has  in that category
2.2 After finding the highest tier, increment the amount of experience in the relevant tier of proficiency unless already a master
2.3 Compare the lowest tier of proficiency determined so far to the current tier. If the current tier is lower, set lowest tier to current tier.
3. After each category is checked, refund a small amount of stamina spent on the swinging the weapon based on the players lowest matching category proficiency
3.a Familiarity provides a 2.5% refund
3.b Proficiency provides a 5% refund
3.c Mastery provides a 10% refund

#### Describe alternatives you've considered
Other alternatives to this have been tracking proficiency only in the specific item, providing a to-hit bonus based on proficiency, an attack move cost discount, or just leaving the proficiency frame work as it is with no benefit to provide support to later additions.

#### Testing
1. New Character
2. Spawn dummies
3. Spawn weapon of appropriate category
4. Attack dummies
5. Check proficiency gain
6. Debug set proficiency to each tier
7. Attack dummies
8. Observe if results match expectation

#### Additional context
While functional, the descriptions for both the practice recipes and the proficiencies themselves are kinda dull, suggestions are well appreciated.

issue.title: Luo Meichen (beggar) bugged companion dialog

labels.name: (S1 - Need confirmation)
labels.description: Report waiting on confirmation of reproducibility

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Someone has introduced specific dialog for Luo Meichen when recruited as a companion. Unfortunately, the dialog is bugged:
- Definitely a bug: The "I just wanted to talk for a bit." dialog entry is duplicated.
- Probably a bug: The TALK_LUO_ORDERS list doesn't have any actions that makes the character useful for anything. In particular, the standard "Let's talk about your current activity" and "Let's talk about the camp" dialog trees.

### Attach save file

N/A It's not save specific. The overriding dialog is found in luo_follower.json

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go through the beggars' quest chain to report the beggars.
2. Talk to Luo and find the above issues in the dialog.

### Expected behavior

The dialog should contain everything normal companion dialog contains when it comes to options. The differences should be in flavor and possibly additional options, not reductions.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Versions and configuration

- OS: Windows
    - OS Version: 10.0.19045.3570 (22H2)
- Game Version: 0.G-4656-g10cdb0ceaf [64-bit]
- Graphics Version: Tiles
- Game Language: System language []
- Mods loaded: [
    Dark Days Ahead [dda],
    Disable NPC Needs [no_npc_food],
    Portal Storms Ignore NPCs [personal_portal_storms],
    Slowdown Fungal Growth [no_fungal_growth]
]
+ hack to disable portal storms

### Additional context

It's possible to work around the inability to get Luo to do anything useful via dialog by using the "Tell someone to work on..." general talk order, so she can be made to sort out loot and chop up trees (when given an axe).

As a side note, the nerfing of Brandon Gardner is too extreme, as he's given an INT of 0 in my game. BEGGAR_4_Brandon_Garder.json has a "bonus_int" of -6 to -2, although I can't find what the baseline it modifies is supposed to be.

issue.title: Adjust character creation feedback power levels

labels.name: <Suggestion / Discussion>
labels.description: Talk it out before implementing

issue.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

I'm completely in support of moving away from points, but it turns out power level feedback is still pretty subjective in the end. Apparently some people even feel uneasy about being labeled powerful or overpowered, or in general disagree with the "accuracy" judgement of the feedback.

### Solution you would like.

Besides subjectively modifying power levels up and down, which is more or less reverting back to the pitfalls of the point system, I'd like to suggest replacing the words with symbols. For example, instead of strong, powerful, overpowered ect., display +, ++, and +++ instead. I feel symbols like this can present a more neutral connotation to the reader, as opposed to words which may be interpreted more strongly.

### Describe alternatives you have considered.

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

pull_request.title: Ledges provide sight coverage
pull_request.body:
<!-- HOW TO USE: Under each "#### Heading" below, enter information relevant to your pull request.
Leave the headings unless they don't apply to your PR.

Please read carefully and don't delete the comments delimited by "< !--" and "-- >"
Once a pull request is submitted, automatic stylistic and consistency checks will be performed on the PR's changes.
The results of these can be either seen under the "Files changed" section of a PR or in the check's details.

NOTE: Please grant permission for repository maintainers to edit your PR.  It is EXTREMELY common for PRs to be held up due to trivial changes being requested and the author being unavailable to make them. -->

#### Summary
Features "Ledges provide sight coverage"
<!-- This section should consist of exactly one line, edit the one above.
1. Replace the word "Category" with one of these words: Features, Content, Interface, Mods, Balance, Bugfixes, Performance, Infrastructure, Build, I18N.
2. Replace the text inside the quotes with a brief description of your changes.
Or if you don't want a changelog entry, replace the whole line with just the word "None" (with no quotes).
For more on the meaning of each category, see:
https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/blob/master/doc/CHANGELOG_GUIDELINES.md
If approved and merged, your summary will be added to the project changelog:
https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/blob/master/data/changelog.txt -->

#### Purpose of change
Creatures ignore walls on their z-level when spotting characters on the z-level above.  A zombie staring at a wall should not be able to see a character on the roof at the opposite end.
<!-- With a few sentences, describe your reasons for making this change.  If it relates to an existing issue, you can link it with a # followed by the GitHub issue number, like #1234.  If your pull request *fully* resolves an issue, include the word "Fix" or "Fixes" before the issue number, like: Fixes #xxxx
If there is no related issue, explain here what issue, feature, or other concern you are addressing.  If this is a bugfix, include steps to reproduce the original bug, so your fix can be verified. -->

#### Describe the solution
![ledge](https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/assets/129854247/6fe114ad-8ed4-4349-ae33-938766ae8d7c)
Introduce overly complex calculations to simulate how much of a character is obscured by a ledge when viewed by a creature below.  It takes into account the height of the ledge, distances of both creatures from the ledge, creature sizes of both viewer and target, and any furniture they are standing on.  The angle of the viewer's eye height to the ledge is extrapolated to the distance of the target to determine how much height the ledge covers at that point.

Part of the existing coverage system has been refactored to allow both ledge coverage and crouch/furniture coverage to interact nicely with each other.  Crouching and lying prone allows a character to remain hidden when ledge coverage is insufficient to cover their full body height.  Ledge and furniture coverage do not stack and only the highest of both is used.

<!-- How does the feature work, or how does this fix a bug?  The easier you make your solution to understand, the faster it can get merged. -->

#### Describe alternatives you've considered

<!-- Explain any alternative solutions, different approaches, or possibilities you've considered using to solve the same problem. -->

#### Testing
Builds successfully.
New character created in the "Surrounded" scenario.
Teleported character to a rooftop.
Creatures on z-level below that are too close to the wall are unable to see the character, while those further away can.
Moving closer to the ledge make the character visible to more creatures.
Crouching and lying prone makes the character visible to less creatures.
No detectable increase in draw times.
<!-- Describe what steps you took to test that this PR resolved the bug or added the feature, and what tests you performed to make sure it didn't cause any regressions.  Also include testing suggestions for reviewers and maintainers. See TESTING_YOUR_CHANGES.md -->

issue.title: Clock timers, temperature sensors and light sensors

labels.name: <Suggestion / Discussion>
labels.description: Talk it out before implementing

labels.name: Items / Item Actions / Item Qualities
labels.description: Items and how they work and interact

issue.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

There are several appliances and devices that would benefit from being able to fine-tune their active and inactive periods with timers, temperature sensors or light sensors - such as stereo systems, heaters, coolers, lights/lamps, doors, window curtains...

### Solution you would like.

Adding tool/appliance-only tags called 'set timer', 'adjust temperature sensor settings' and 'adjust light sensor settings'. Items with these tags can be activate to do the following:

Set timer - Set when a device is on/off by specifying clock time. Requires clockworks or similar timekeeping device/materials as a component. May also include a beep alarm to tell you when a device shuts on/off in this fashion.

Adjust temperature sensor settings - allows you to set when a device is on/off depending on the ambient temperature in its current square (or if carried/worn by a survivor, their body temperature). Requires a thermometer or bimetal thermostat as a component.

Adjust Light sensor settings - allows you to set when a device is 'active' and 'inactive' depending on the lighting in its current square. Would require photocells as a component (currently does not exist as a spare part). Treats being in any pocket/container as being in darkness.

### Describe alternatives you have considered.

Having the above function as individual tool mods you attach to devices you want to automate. Using sensor arrays in a similar fashion.

### Additional context

Ha ha automation go brrrrr

labels.name: EOC: Effects On Condition
labels.description: Anything concerning Effects On Condition

issue.body:
#### Summary
Features "Weapon Proficiency"

#### Purpose of change
As it stands, weapon selection in Catacylsm is a choice between the three core damage types of Bash, Slash, and Stab, with the player either selecting whatever does the most damage in the area the have the highest skill, or to choose a sub-optimal weapon for roleplay purposes. This leads to a lack of nuance in weapon selection that isn't as interesting to engage with as it could be.

#### Describe the solution
This adds a system that adds weapon proficiencies for each melee weapon type across three tier of proficiency. A player can now gain category familiarity, category proficiency, and category mastery for each category.  It adds EoCs to allow an increase in each weapon category proficiency, and does so by:

1. Proc the EoCs on a successful hit on either a Monster or a Character
2. Compare each weapon category to the wielded weapon
2.1 On a match with the wielded weapon, check the highest tier of proficiency the player has  in that category
2.2 After finding the highest tier, increment the amount of experience in the relevant tier of proficiency unless already a master
2.3 Compare the lowest tier of proficiency determined so far to the current tier. If the current tier is lower, set lowest tier to current tier.
3. After each category is checked, refund a small amount of stamina spent on the swinging the weapon based on the players lowest matching category proficiency
3.a Familiarity provides a 2.5% refund
3.b Proficiency provides a 5% refund
3.c Mastery provides a 10% refund

#### Describe alternatives you've considered
Other alternatives to this have been tracking proficiency only in the specific item, providing a to-hit bonus based on proficiency, an attack move cost discount, or just leaving the proficiency frame work as it is with no benefit to provide support to later additions.

#### Testing
1. New Character
2. Spawn dummies
3. Spawn weapon of appropriate category
4. Attack dummies
5. Check proficiency gain
6. Debug set proficiency to each tier
7. Attack dummies
8. Observe if results match expectation

#### Additional context
While functional, the descriptions for both the practice recipes and the proficiencies themselves are kinda dull, suggestions are well appreciated.

pull_request.title: Add foreach function to EoC and simplify vitamin reset syntax
pull_request.body:
#### Summary
Features "Add foreach function to EoC"

#### Purpose of change
EoC does not have a function to enumerate the IDs of objects that exist in the game (e.g. vitamin, trait, itemgroup)
This makes the process of resetting vitamins present in Xedra_Evolved very cumbersome.

```
      { "math": [ "u_pain()", "=", "0" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('stored_kcal')", "=", "65000" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('thirst')", "=", "0" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('vitamin', 'name: bad_food')", "=", "0" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('vitamin', 'name: blood')", "=", "0" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('vitamin', 'name: human_blood_vitamin')", "=", "0" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('vitamin', 'name: calcium')", "=", "0" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('vitamin', 'name: instability')", "=", "0" ] },
                           :
                           :
      { "math": [ "u_val('vitamin', 'name: mutagen_ursine')", "=", "0" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('vitamin', 'name: mutagenic_slurry')", "=", "0" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('vitamin', 'name: mutant_toxin')", "=", "0" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('vitamin', 'name: redcells')", "=", "0" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('vitamin', 'name: vitC')", "=", "0" ] }
```

#### Describe the solution
Add a foreach function that sequentially processes the values ​​in a list (for example, the id of vitamin)
This makes the above process as simple as

```
      { "math": [ "u_pain()", "=", "0" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('stored_kcal')", "=", "65000" ] },
      { "math": [ "u_val('thirst')", "=", "0" ] },
      {
        "foreach": "ids",
        "var": { "context_val": "id" },
        "target": "vitamin",
        "effect": [ { "math": [ "u_vitamin(_id)", "=", "0" ] } ]
      }
```

foreach can be used for itemgroups and traits in addition to vitamins, for example, the following process enumerates items belonging to forest of itemgroup

```
  {
    "type": "effect_on_condition",
    "id": "EOC_foreach_test",
    "effect": [
      {
        "foreach": "item_group",
        "var": { "context_val": "id" },
        "target": "forest",
        "effect": [ { "u_message": "<context_val:id>" } ]
      }
    ]
  }
```
![image](https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/assets/13540013/a82b1152-a214-4612-8db3-c8da902ff397)

Or simple string array.

```
  {
    "type": "effect_on_condition",
    "id": "EOC_foreach_test",
    "effect": [
      {
        "foreach": "array",
        "var": { "context_val": "id" },
        "target": [ "a", "b", "c" ],
        "effect": [ { "u_message": "<context_val:id>" } ]
      }
    ]
  }
```
#### Describe alternatives you've considered


#### Testing
Add a sample example_eocs.json and worked collectly.

#### Additional context
Are there any other values ​​that would be useful to enumerate?
